description: 'The Writing's on the Wall' - a celebration of the street art of East London. Join Mr Londoner, aka former museum director and Blue Badge guide Antony Robbins, to discover the best street art in Shoreditch and beyond.

events.name: Walking tour by qualified London Blue Badge guide
events.notes: The event will be entirely outside and is accessible to all.

factsheet.heading: Walking tour - history and contemporary culture
paragraphs: What should local authorities do about ‘graffiti’?

Treat it as a social menace, slap an ASBO on the perpetrators and give them a scrubbing brush? Or should they protect the hallowed works of artists like Banksy, Stik and Thierry Noir behind hastily-erected sheets of protective perspex?

Mr Londoner explores London’s street art scene in the ‘Writing’s on the Wall’ – during a walking tour of Spitalfields and Shoreditch. See some of our city's very best and surprising urban art, learn a bit about the history of the gritty streets that inspired all this creative energy - and discover the genre’s very own secret language.

Duration 90 mins
Meet: Dick's pub, 202, Bishopsgate, EC2
Saturday 4 Sept 2021, 11am
@Meetmrlondoner

images.title: Frenchman Thierry Noir is the elder statesman of the street art scenee.
Some people refer to Anglo-Australian Jimmy C's street art as 'Aboriginal Pointillism'.
Some of the best street art takes no prisoners, Fashion Street, E1.
Stik's work consists of a few lines, two dots and a circle ... yet it's remarkably expressive
Ben Eine's work uses a bold font and it always intrigues, Middlesex Street, E1.

name: Writing's on the Wall
